botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Harmful if eaten. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Delphinium can be annuals, biennials or perennials, with palmately lobed basal leaves and showy bowl-shaped flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles

how_to_grow.cultivation: Will grow well in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun and apply a balanced liquid fertilizer every other week during the growing season. It will need shelter from strong winds; staking may be necessary. See staking: perennials
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by basal cuttings in early spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead spent flower spikes back to fresh flowering side shoots and cut back to ground level in late autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs, snails, leaf miners and caterpillars
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Powdery mildews, delphinium black blotch, crown rot and viruses
